meanings.definition: To appoint or authorize as a deputy.
meanings.sent1: The sheriff was deputizing a new officer to help maintain peace in the town.
meanings.sent2: She will be deputizing for her boss while he is on vacation next week.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought it was deputizing for the dog in guarding the house.
meanings.sent4: The sun deputized the moon to light up the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher deputized the student to collect the homework from the class.

meanings.definition: To act as a deputy or substitute for someone else.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, John will be deputizing for the absent team leader.
meanings.sent2: The vice president will be deputizing in the president's absence.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel deputized for the bird in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her smile deputized for words of comfort in that moment.
meanings.sent5: The superhero deputized for the police in catching the thief.
